name: Antibot-Detector
description: Real-time detection of anti-bot systems, CAPTCHAs & fingerprinting techniques. Identifies Cloudflare, Akamai, DataDome, reCAPTCHA, hCaptcha, Shape Security & more with confidence scoring and advanced capture tools.
readme_summary: The Scrapfly Anti-bot Detector is a Manifest V3 Chrome extension designed to identify and analyze various anti-bot systems, CAPTCHAs, and browser fingerprinting techniques in real-time. It provides detailed insights, confidence scores, and advanced capture tools for security researchers and web developers.
key_features: Real-time detection of CAPTCHAs, anti-bot systems, and fingerprinting techniques
Multi-layer detection system including DOM analysis, network monitoring, payload analysis, JavaScript hooks, and window property checks
Modern UI with badge indicator, detection history, and advanced capture tools for specific systems
Performance optimizations like smart caching, pattern caching, early exit, and lazy evaluation
Privacy-focused with no data collection and CSP compliance
primary_use_case: To detect and analyze anti-bot systems, CAPTCHAs, and browser fingerprinting techniques in real-time for security research and web development.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant digital detective, wearing a magnifying glass as a monocle, stands before a complex web of glowing data streams representing internet traffic. The detective is actively sifting through these streams, holding up a shield that highlights specific 'bot' signatures in red while allowing legitimate 'human' traffic (represented by soft blue particles) to pass through unimpeded. Small, stylized browser windows and code snippets float subtly in the background, hinting at the extension's functionality. The scene is set in a clean, futuristic interface with a dark background and vibrant, contrasting highlights, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a focus on clarity and visual metaphor.

name: chirp
readme_summary: Chirp is a TypeScript application that enables data transfer through sound. It encodes text into audio frequencies for transmission via speakers and decodes received audio back into text, featuring real-time frequency visualization.
key_features: Real-time frequency visualization of audio input
Send messages by converting text to sound
Receive messages by listening to sound and decoding it back to text
Distinctive start and end signatures to mark transmissions
primary_use_case: To demonstrate and enable the transmission and reception of text-based data using audible sound waves, primarily for educational or proof-of-concept purposes.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical scene depicting sound waves as colorful, tangible ribbons flowing from a vintage speaker towards a microphone. One ribbon is being unraveled by a friendly robot, revealing clear text characters like 'H', 'e', 'l', 'l', 'o'. Another ribbon is being woven into existence from typed letters on a small, glowing tablet. The background is a softly lit, minimalist studio space. Subtle UI elements showing frequency graphs are visible on the tablet screen. The overall mood is playful and innovative, highlighting the magic of turning sound into data. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with vibrant colors and a clean, friendly aesthetic, incorporating the name 'Chirp' subtly on the speaker.

name: serviceradar
description: opensource network management and observability platform
readme_summary: ServiceRadar is a distributed network monitoring system designed for infrastructure and services in constrained or hard-to-reach environments. It offers real-time monitoring, distributed architecture, and cloud-based alerting, supporting various data collection methods like metrics, logs, traces, and SNMP.
key_features: Real-time Monitoring
Distributed Architecture
SRQL (ServiceRadar Query Language)
Unified Data Layer (CloudNativePG, TimescaleDB, Apache AGE)
Observability (OTEL, GELF, Syslog, SNMP, NetFlow, RPerf, BGP, gNMI)
Graph Network Mapper
Security (mTLS via SPIFFE, RBAC, SSO)
Rule Engine (Rust-based)
Specialized Monitoring (Dusk Network nodes)
primary_use_case: Network management and observability for distributed systems, especially in constrained or hard-to-reach environments.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant lighthouse keeper on a rocky, remote island, using a powerful, glowing spyglass to scan the vast, dark ocean. The spyglass beams of light reveal hidden ships (representing network devices) and their status (glowing green for healthy, red for alerts). Small, stylized data streams flow from the spyglass towards a distant, serene cloud. The lighthouse itself has subtle 'ServiceRadar' branding. The scene is set at dusk with dramatic, atmospheric lighting, emphasizing the isolation and the importance of the monitoring. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with clear, bold outlines and a color palette of deep blues, grays, and vibrant light beams.

name: base-stack
description: This is a React starter kit that provides an opinionated, production-ready foundation for building modern web applications
readme_summary: Base Stack is an opinionated React starter kit designed to provide a production-ready foundation for building modern web applications. It offers a curated set of tools and patterns to accelerate development and ensure a seamless developer experience.
key_features: React starter kit
Opinionated foundation
Production-ready
Modern web applications
Curated tools and patterns
primary_use_case: To provide developers with a pre-configured, robust starting point for building new React web applications quickly and efficiently.
cover_image_prompt: A master architect standing at the blueprint of a futuristic city, holding a glowing blueprint that is rapidly assembling into a complete, vibrant metropolis. The architect is pointing to a section of the blueprint, which is transforming into a functional, modern web application interface with clean UI elements. Small, subtle digital particles representing code and data flow from the blueprint to the city. The scene is set in a bright, clean studio with a sense of organized creation. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clear lines, a modern color palette, and a feeling of immediate productivity. The repository name 'Base Stack' is subtly integrated into a signpost in the background.

name: superseedr
description: A Rust BitTorrent Client in your Terminal
readme_summary: Superseedr is a terminal-based BitTorrent client written in Rust, offering a high-performance TUI for real-time swarm observability, secure Docker integration with VPN support, and automatic network configuration. It prioritizes speed, privacy, and reliability for desktop and server use.
key_features: Animated, high-performance TUI (1â€“60 FPS)
OS-level magnet link support
Real-time network graphs and swarm analytics
Official Docker + VPN setup with automatic port forwarding
Dynamic inbound port reloading without restarting the client
Unparalleled Reliability & Correctness through Model-Based Testing
Private Tracker Builds without PEX and DHT
Rust-based engine for performance and safety
Persistent state with crash recovery
Peer-level metrics and availability heatmaps
primary_use_case: A terminal-based BitTorrent client with advanced swarm analytics and secure Docker integration.
cover_image_prompt: A bustling, futuristic cityscape viewed from a high vantage point, with glowing data streams connecting various buildings like a complex network. In the foreground, a stylized, transparent terminal window hovers, displaying intricate real-time graphs and heatmaps of the data flow. Small, stylized BitTorrent 'seed' icons are visible within the data streams, representing torrent activity. The overall mood is one of organized, high-tech information management and connectivity, with subtle digital particles and a clean, modern aesthetic. The repository name 'Superseedr' is subtly integrated into a building's signage. 3D isometric illustration style, vibrant blues and greens, high detail.
